snippet: The mix tape in the soundtrack “Guardians of the Galaxy: Awesome Mix Tape Vol. 1,” refers to a music cassette that was given to Peter Quill, played by Chris Pratt, above, by his dying mother. He plays it on a Walkman. “Guardians” topped the...
lead_paragraph: The mix tape in the soundtrack “Guardians of the Galaxy: Awesome Mix Tape Vol. 1,” refers to a music cassette that was given to Peter Quill, played by Chris Pratt, above, by his dying mother. He plays it on a Walkman. “Guardians” topped the Billboard 200 chart this week, where soundtracks can be more popular than music by the original artists. “Jersey Boys” is No. 60 and “Get On Up: The James Brown Story” is No. 61, compared with “The Very Best of Frankie Valli and the Four Seasons” (No. 151), and “20 All-Time Greatest Hits! James Brown” (No. 170).
